content.rendered:
If you wish to refresh your mind, spirits and soul amid the thickets of Rhododendrons, cool mountain breeze and alpine woods, then the Binsar hill resort of Uttarakhand is one ideal destination to give you the retreat from the fever and fret of life. Find all necessary info below.

Travelling To the Mystic Binsar


Binsar, with its setting in the Himalayas, is one of the most favoured tourist destinations in Uttarakhand. Situated some kilometres from the beautiful land of Nainital, this place is covered with rhododendron trees and alpine forests which will offer you the ideal scenic retreat. This place was once a part of the Chand Empire in the 7th century and now stands as a land of peace and solitude. The place is gifted with an amazing bird sanctuary and forest reserve boasting of rich flora and fauna variety.

Important Peaks in Binsar:

Binsar falls within the district of Almora and is a hill resort known for its serenity standing 2,400m above the sea level. It lies in the ‘Jhandi Dhar’ hills and is ranked among the Kumaon’s highest points. You will also be able the find some of the prominent peaks here including Kedarnath, Nanda Devi, Trishul, Chaukhamba, Nanda Kot and Panchachuli. The snowy peaks make you feel extremely close to them.

Planning A Binsar Trip:

When you next plan to visit Uttarakhand you must include Binsar in the list so that you can have your senses refreshed and your soul rejuvenated. This place is situated 380km away from Gaya Bihar, the capital of India. The nearest airport is 127km away at Pant Nagar and the closest railway station is situated 85km away in Kathgodam. Apart from the snow-covered religious shrines you can visit the well-known Binsar forest reserve.

Binsar Forest Reserve:

Uttarakhand’s famous reserve, this place houses several wild animals as well as the aviary species. You can spot the Himalayan palm civet, Ghoral, serow, yellow-bellied weasel, yellow-throated Himalayan marten, Himalayan Black Bear and fox on your trip to this wildlife sanctuary. And a breathtaking Himalayan view is mandatory in your visit here. The combination of natural beauty and the species thriving in this climatic condition is one that is worth treasuring for anyone visiting this place.

Other Tourist Spots:

The ‘Binsar Mahadev Temple’ that was constructed by the famous King Kalyan also makes the place popular. This temple is among the 12 ‘Jyotirlingas’ present in India. So, you will not only get a respite from the city heat but can also work on your spiritual reformation while visiting this serene place. You get the opportunity to explore the nature of this place on foot and enjoy the weather that will add to your excitement and fun. This place is ideal for trekking activities as well.

Trekking Activity:

The amazing landscape of Binsar attracts several trekkers from the entire world to get a taste of its rugged terrain. You can trek all the way from Nainital district which lies 95km from here or 33 km north of Almora to reach this place. It will keep you away from the crowded tourist areas and city life. The place offers you time alone in solitude which you need very badly in your busy life and with the trekking activity you will even regain your physical health.

All these attractions of Binsar are enough to plan a visit to this place the next time you want a break from your heavily-packed life.
